column4: Hi all , i have just installed 3D Desktop on Ubuntu via Synaptic. Now my PC fails during boot with failed to start X. Is there a way i can uninstall 3D desktop and get my machine working again? :)
when the boot prompt asks... hit ESC... choose 'rescue'
I can boot in rescue mode, but this just brings me to a prompt. Being pretty new to linux and without a nice gui i'm lost. What do i do?
I wasn't following along... what are you trying to do?
i have just installed 3D Desktop on Ubuntu via Synaptic. Now my PC fails during boot with failed to start X. Is there a way i can uninstall 3D desktop and get my machine working again? :)
bah... go to rescue mode... dpkg -P 3ddesktop ... restart
you really don't wish you found it 10 years ago though... 10 years ago... you'd never have gotten it installed... and we were stuck with TWM
3ddesktop adds things to your home?
If i had founf it 10 years ago, i would be pretty good a bash by now!
sorry 'sudo dpkg ...' yes?
doesn't matter... rescue mode is root only
of course
seems like somewhat of a security flaw to me... local exploits are way too easy in Ubuntu without a grub password.
&& munki : Hopefully I will be back in 5. Wish me luck! Otherwise I'll be back in 10 (It takes about that long for windows to boot!)  and thank you for all your help!
can you tell me what package i need to re install to get the X thingy working again?
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I think he's being figurative
Hmm... how to make yourself look dumb in one easy move! Doh!
heh... its cool... its hard to notice such things through text  :P
So you use the dpkg rather than apt-get. I assume that is because the discussion had earlier with munki?
for local files... umm, yeah
Thanks for your help. back in a mo on ubuntu hopefully!
